required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter, Observational, Registry to Assess Outcomes of Patients Treated With the CE Marked Nellix® System for Endovascular Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Repair"

brief_summary.textblock: Multicenter, single arm, open label, registry study with consecutive, eligible patient enrollment at each site. All subjects undergoing the Endovascular Aneurysm Sealing System (EVAS) with the Nellix®-System. Subjects will be followed procedurally to discharge, and as per institutional standard of care thereafter through to 5 years (total follow-up commitment)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with Immediate Procedural Technical Success
primary_outcome.description: Technical success is defined as successful delivery and deployment of the Nellix System in the planned location.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessment by Number of subjects with absence of Major Adverse Events (MAEs)
primary_outcome.description: Safety endpoint is measured with the number of subjects who are reported freedome of major adverse events (MAEs) including (1) all-cause death, (2) bowel ischemia, (3) myocardial infarction, (4) paraplegia, (5) renal failure, (6) respiratory failure, (7) stroke, and (8) Blood Loss > 1000mL at 30 Days post index procedure.

other_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with Aneurysm rupture
other_outcome.description: The number of patients experiencing a rupture of the aneurysm will be summarized at 30 days and within each follow-up window (i.e., six months, and annually at years 1 through 5).

other_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with Conversion to open surgical repair
other_outcome.description: The number of patients undergoing surgical conversion to open repair will be provided at 30 days and within each follow-up window (i.e., six months, and annually at years 1 through 5).

other_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with Endoleak of any type
other_outcome.description: The number of patients with any endoleak, and patients with each endoleak type at 30 days and within each follow-up window (i.e., six months, and annually at years 1 through 5) will be summarized.

other_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with Clinically significant migration
other_outcome.description: The number of patients with clinically significant migration will be summarized descriptively.

other_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with Aneurysm enlargement
other_outcome.description: The number of patients with Aneurysm enlargement will be summarized descriptively. Sac enlargement is defined in the protocol as increase in late follow-up compared to the initial post-op measurement.

other_outcome.measure: Number of incidence with Secondary endovascular procedures
other_outcome.description: The overall secondary procedure incidence and the individual component incidence will be provided.

other_outcome.measure: Number of incidence with Distal Complications
other_outcome.description: The number of incidence of distal thrombosis, embolization and iliac stenosis will be summarized.

other_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with incidence of device patency and integrity
other_outcome.description: Device patency and integrity will be measured by the number and proportion of patients at 30 days, 6 months, and 1 year to 5 years including Stent Kinking, Lumen Occlusion, and Stent Fracture.

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed with AAA who are considered candidates for Endovascular Repair and meet the study eligibility criteria and sign the Informed consent may be subsequently enrolled in the study.

intervention.description: The Nellix system is comprised of two independent flow channels, one to each iliac artery. Each flow channel consists of a balloon-expanded ePTFE covered stent surrounded by a Polymer-filled EndoBag which fills the blood lumen within the aorta, and seals the aneurysm from side-branch flow.

study_pop.textblock: Patients diagnosed with AAA who are considered candidates for Endovascular Repair and meet the study eligibility criteria and sign the Informed consent may be subsequently enrolled in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female at least 18 years old
2. Subject has signed informed consent for data release
3. Subjects with with AAA and eligible for endovascular repair
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Currently participating in another study where primary endpoint has not been reached yet
2. Known allergy to any of the device components
3. Pregnant (females of childbearing potential only)
